docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20.--The third day's session of the International American Conference was devoted entirely to efforts to perfect the organization. Senor Romero of Mexico presented the report of the Committee on Credentials.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 20.--The third day's session of the International American Conference was devoted entirely to efforts to perfect the organization. Senor Romero of Mexico presented the report of the Committee on Credentials.

headline.main: ORGANIZING FOR WORK.; THE INTERNATIONAL AMERICAN CONGRESS IN SESSION.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21.--Secretary Blaine called the International American Conference to order this afternoon, but immediately relinquished the chair to Dr. Guzman, the delegate from Nicaragua. While the minutes were being read Senhor Valente, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21.--Secretary Blaine called the International American Conference to order this afternoon, but immediately relinquished the chair to Dr. Guzman, the delegate from Nicaragua. While the minutes were being read Senhor Valente, the Brazilian Minister, and Senhor Mendonca, the second delegate from Brazil, appeared in the conference room and took seats near to but not at the table.

headline.main: DOM PEDRO'S DELEGATES; THEY WILL SIT IN THE INTERNATIONAL CONGRESS. AN EFFORT TO INDUCE THE CONFERENCE TO FORMALLY RECOGNIZE THERE PUBLIC OF BRAZIL VOTED DOWN.

docs.snippet: Many distinguished members of the Admiralty Bar of this city gave a very elaborate entertainment in the Hotel Brunswick last evening to several of the delegates to the International Marine Conference, which has been in progress in Washington. There...
docs.lead_paragraph: Many distinguished members of the Admiralty Bar of this city gave a very elaborate entertainment in the Hotel Brunswick last evening to several of the delegates to the International Marine Conference, which has been in progress in Washington. headline.main: LAWYERS AMONG FLOWERS; THE DINNER GIVEN BY THE ADMIRALTY BAR. DELEGATES TO THE MARITIME CONVENTION THE GUESTS OE THE EVENING--THE WORK OF THE CONFERENCE.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25.--Twenty-eight delegates were present this afternoon when the international American conference was called to order. Dr. Zegarra of Peru presided. The temporary Secretary, Dr. Guzman, read the report of the Committee on...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 25.--Twenty-eight delegates were present this afternoon when the international American conference was called to order. Dr. Zegarra of Peru presided. The temporary Secretary, Dr. Guzman, read the report of the Committee on Credentials passing favorably upon the credentials of the Brazilian delegates and those of Mr. Cornelius Bliss.

headline.main: THE PAN-AMERICAN CONGRESS.; DELEGATES FROM BRAZIL AGAIN IN THEIR SEATS--ORGANIZING.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29.--Dr. Nin, the delegate from Uruguay, presided over the deliberations of the International American Conference today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29.--Dr. Nin, the delegate from Uruguay, presided over the deliberations of the International American Conference today.

headline.main: ARRANGING THEIR RULES.; SLOW WORK OF THE PAN-AMERICAN CONFERENCE.

docs.snippet: The steamship Capua arrived yesterday from Brazil, but as she had touched at only one port of that country since the declaration of the republic, her officers possessed little information in regard to the revolution. Capt. Kuckenthal says that he...
docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Capua arrived yesterday from Brazil, but as she had touched at only one port of that country since the declaration of the republic, her officers possessed little information in regard to the revolution. Capt. Kuckenthal says that he left Santos Nov. 5 and Rio Janeiro Nov.9.

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE CAPUA.; WHAT PROVINCIAL PAPERS HAVE TO SAY OF THE REPUBLIC.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 30.--Fifteen days have elapsed since the empire was overthrown, and the authority of the provisional Government which took its place and proclaimed the republic has not met with the slightest show of resistance in any of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 30.--Fifteen days have elapsed since the empire was overthrown, and the authority of the provisional Government which took its place and proclaimed the republic has not met with the slightest show of resistance in any of the twenty provinces.

headline.main: BRAZIL AND HER DESTINY; PERILS THAT BESET THE NEW REPUBLIC. DANGEROUS DELAYS OF THE PROVISIONAL GOVERNMENT--DIFFICULTIES OF FORMING A SOLID UNION.

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Nov. 28.--The men who have before them the work of founding the Republic of the United States of Brazil will, of course, be judged by the results. The possibilities are uncommonly great, because the extent of territory comprehended...

headline.main: BRAZIL'S NATURAL GIFTS.; POSSIBILITIES BEFORE THE MEN WHO WILL GUIDE THE NEW REPUBLIC.
